Author: Franke et al., 2010
Habitat.type: Beech grove, a residual alluvial forest with a marsh area, and agricultural crop land containing two sedimentation ponds with reeds. Also a small pond with reeds and sedges, a well-developed field layer, an understory, and deciduous trees.
Species.English: Common blackbird, Eurasian blackcap, blue tit, common chiffchaff, dunnock, Eurasian bullfinch, European robin, great tit, marsh warbler, reed warbler, song thrush and winter wren
Notes: The tested ticks came from 56 animals. The two positive larvae were from a robin and a blackbird. One of the infected nymphs came from the same blackbird
